title: Russia to launch first all-Roscosmos cosmonaut mission to station
summary: The Russian federal space agency Roscosmos is set to launch a Soyuz 2.1a with three cosmonauts to the International Space Station (ISS) Friday, March 18 at 11:55 am EDT (15:55 UTC) aboard the Soyuz MS-21 mission.

title: SpaceX set to break another Falcon 9 reusability record [webcast]
summary: SpaceX says a Falcon 9 rocket is on track to launch Starlink 4-12 – a new batch of 53 satellites – no...

title: China is developing new solid rockets to boost overall space capabilities
summary: Chinese state-owned entities are developing a growing range of solid rockets to meet growing launch demands and contribute to a wider strategy of making China a fully-fledged space power.

title: SLS rolls out to pad for countdown test
summary: The first Space Launch System rocket rolled out to its launch pad here March 17 for a countdown dress rehearsal ahead of its long-delayed launch this summer on the uncrewed Artemis 1 mission.

title: SpaceX to launch reusable booster for record 12th time
summary: SpaceX raised a veteran Falcon 9 booster vertical on a launch pad at Cape Canaveral late Thursday, ready for a record-setting 12th mission Friday night with 53 more Starlink internet satellites.

title: Orbit Fab gets $12 million to integrate refueling port with military satellites
summary: Orbit Fab, a venture-funded startup offering a refueling service in space, announced it has won a $12 million deal to ensure its fueling interface works with U.S. military satellites.

title: International talks on space norms to continue but U.S. will not engage directly with Russia
summary: Bilateral U.S.-Russia space talks that had begun before the invasion of Ukraine are off the table for now, a U.S. State Department official said March 17.

title: NASA moon rocket SLS rolls out to “rebuilt” LC-39B ahead of Artemis 1 rehearsal
summary: A moment more than a decade in the making. NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket for the Artemis 1 mission made its first trip down the crawlerway at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Thursday evening, March 17.

title: ESA suspends work with Russia on ExoMars mission
summary: ESA has formally halted plans to launch its ExoMars mission on a Russian rocket in September in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Sierra Space to work with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries on commercial space station technologies
summary: Sierra Space and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) have signed an agreement to study collaboration on technologies to support a planned commercial space station.
